ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: First time player
ygData.msgSnippet: I hear for a necro in wide open spaces you can snare/fear and sick your pet on some mobs. Well, I pretty much watched a necro do that. :-) luv, -Su Hit
ygData.messageBody:
I hear for a necro in wide open spaces you can snare/fear and sick your pet
on some mobs.
Well, I pretty much watched a necro do that. :-)
luv,
-Su

Hit skyfire, you won't have any problems to solo your way up to 60 here if
you can't find groups. Just fear kite (read some about what mobs you should
focus on for each level).

-domi

-----Ursprungligt meddelande-----
Från: bigmaca3 [mailto:bigmaca3@...]
Skickat: den 22 februari 2002 06:25
Till: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Ämne: [EverQuest] Re: First time player


--- In EverQuest@y..., "Su" <suceress@k...> wrote:
>
> I've been playing for over a year and a half and my main just got
to lvl 39.
> My very first character is lvl 6. Oh, and my next highest is 29.
> luv,
> -Su
> >
> > wrote:
> > > Welcome to EQ! Your life will never be the same.
> > > Having never played a
> > > Pally, here are some general thoughts:
> > >
> > > #1 DOn't feel rushed to get your first character up
> > > to higher levels. EQ is
> > > a huge place and there is so much to do and see. If
> > > you take your time you
> > > will have a much better experience, IMHO! (I played
> > > my Ranger for a year
> > > and he only reached 27).
> >
> > Ok, and how often did you play? and and what really
> > took you that long?
> >
> > Honestly man, what were you doing all that time?

My Ranger has recently reached 33 after almost 18 months of play.
I'd say I am sometimes casual, sometimes intense. Just depends. I
spent a lot of time making deliveries for friends, helping out
lowbies and such, and just wandering around. That is what Rangers
are supposed to do, right?

Tul
